definition: to come one after the other
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to arrive/to follow/heel
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: After the defeat great disorders followed.
sentences.chinese: 失敗之後，接踵而來的是大混亂。

sentences.english: Fleece goes in the bag. Repeat with countless other items.
sentences.chinese: 長袖衫入袋，無數其他物品接踵而來。

sentences.english: Troubles that come, happiness that fulfills, and eternity which someday will be.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩接踵而來，幸福亦會來臨，永遠會在某天出現。
接踵而來的是一場短暫的罵戰。

sentences.english: The Yom Kippur War was followed by an Arab oil embargo.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯石油禁運後接踵而來的是贖罪日戰爭。

sentences.english: As long as the water dropping food variety of fish will wake.
sentences.chinese: 只要往水裏投放魚食各種各樣的小魚就會接踵而來。

sentences.english: The floods that followed tested the Three Gorges Dam to near-capacity.
sentences.chinese: 接踵而來的洪水挑戰了三峽的泄洪極限。

sentences.english: After honor and state, follow envy and hate.
sentences.chinese: 有了名位，嫉妒和仇恨便接踵而來。

sentences.english: Let’s just say good times ensued once Raj started really loosening up.
sentences.chinese: 我們說一旦拉傑放鬆下來，好時光就接踵而來了。

sentences.english: Mid-Autumn purchase small peak has gone, then follow the tide of 11.
sentences.chinese: 中秋購機小高峯已經遠去，緊接着十一狂潮接踵而來。

sentences.english: The passage of time, follow the 15-year-old season.
sentences.chinese: 時光流逝，接踵而來的是十五歲的花季。

sentences.english: Don't forget the many related costs you'll incur after the boat purchase.
sentences.chinese: 別忘記購船之後接踵而來的許多相關開銷。

sentences.english: You get through one deadline but the next one is already knocking on the door.
sentences.chinese: 你到了截止日期才交了工，但另一件已接踵而來。

definition: one after another (idiom)/in quick succession
to be related/to entail/to involve/joint (liability etc)
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
turning point
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
time bomb
to affect/to produce a change in sth
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
to retreat/to shrink back
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
great changes
to sweep clean/to clean out
